alert.note: Alert for Kauai North; Kauai Southwest; Maui Central Valley North; Maui Windward West; Molokai North; Molokai West; Molokai Windward; Niihau; Oahu North Shore; Waianae Coast; Windward Haleakala (Hawaii) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: High Surf Advisory issued April 02 at 3:29AM HST until April 02 at 6:00PM HST by NWS Honolulu
info.description: ...HIGH SURF ADVISORY FOR NORTH AND WEST FACING SHORES OF KAUAI NIIHAU OAHU AND MOLOKAI AND FOR NORTH FACING SHORES OF MAUI... .A northwest swell will continue to produce elevated surf along most north and west facing shores of the smaller Hawaiian Islands through this afternoon. This swell is expected to gradually lower by this evening. ...HIGH SURF ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 PM HST THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Along north facing shores, surf of 12 to 16 feet this morning, and 10 to 15 feet this afternoon. Along west facing shores, surf of 8 to 12 feet. * WHERE...North and west facing shores of Kauai, Niihau, Oahu and Molokai, and north facing shores of Maui * WHEN...Through this afternoon. * IMPACTS...Moderate. Expect strong breaking waves, shore break, and strong longshore and rip currents, making swimming difficult and dangerous.
info.instruction: Beachgoers, swimmers, and surfers should heed all advice given by ocean safety officials, and exercise caution. If in doubt, don`t go out.
